basics.name: Jarvis Johnson
basics.label: Full Stack Engineer
basics.summary: Richard hails from Tulsa. He has earned degrees from the University of Oklahoma and Stanford. (Go Sooners and Cardinals!) Before starting Pied Piper, he worked for Hooli as a part time software developer. While his work focuses on applied information theory, mostly optimizing lossless compression schema of both the length-limited and adaptive variants, his non-work interests range widely, everything from quantum computing to chaos theory. He could tell you about it, but THAT would NOT be a “length-limited” conversation!

Stripe Connect integration for payments (peer-to-peer, application fee)
availability management for rental products (with Sphinx search)
fully custom front end, with React for many components
stack: Ruby, mySQL, webpack, Node.js; hosting: Heroku, (assets S3 + Cloudfront)

references.name: Adam Russell
references.reference: Jarvis was a valued member of my team at MediaCom in Melbourne, where we plan and buy advertising campaigns for some of Australia’s largest companies. Jarvis particularly excelled at mathematical and statistical analysis tasks, including programmatic online ad buying and consumer impact reporting on ad campaigns. He made it known that he desired a more technical role, and this led him to complete a software course outside of work hours, which we supported. Above all, we miss his humour and Jarvis is often talked about in the office; I’m sure he would have the same impact at any company. I'd take him back any day!.

references.name: James Burke
references.reference: Jarvis worked for my development and design agency for close to a year.  He was early in his development career and was clearly eager to learn as much from us as possible.  He learned the basics of WordPress front and back end development very quickly, allowing him to become an immediate asset to us.Jarvis even helped us improve our own workflows, introducing us to technologies such as SASS and Grunt.  His previous career experience was evident as he knew how to handle our stakeholders. Our trust in each other as developers has since found us sharing leads between our business and Swish, Jarvis’s own development business.  Whatever development and web engineering roles Jarvis is looking into I’m certain he’ll be a great asset and push the product forward, as he did with us.
